questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage.
Education aims to bring about positive changes in our behavior. It helps us try to change our lives as well as the society we live in. Education that does not illuminate our minds or does not inspire us to work for the community is not complete at all. Education is not all about getting grades or receiving certificates- we use education to make life better. We are expected to apply the knowledge, skills and values that we learn in a classroom in our engagement with the world that lies outside. And we can do so in many different ways. Let's have a look at how education works. Learners' civic engagement is highly appreciated all over the world. Civic engagement means working to make a difference in the civic life (the public life of the citizens as constructed with private or personal life) of the community using knowledge, skills, values and motivation. Civic engagement promotes the quality of life in a community by contributing to the improvement of health and wellbeing of the people.
Civically engaged individuals recognize themselves as members of a larger social community and are concerned about civic issues. They consider themselves responsible citizens who take action or raise their voices against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills.
In civic engagement, issues of public concern are crucial. Civic engagement includes individual or group activities to protect public interests and change the way the community values itself. For example, If you are protesting against any unjust decision of the local municipality such as raising taxes or an act that might work against people's interests, you are civically engaged and your action is considered a civic engagement. This protest can be done in different ways such as organizing rallies, collecting signatures, making human chains, writing petitions, etc. You can also help control traffic in front of a school, help children to cross the roads, work in a team to clean a park or a sea beach. You can also give some services to elderly people. These are all examples of civic engagement as what you do directly affects the community.
When civic engagement is a part of an academic program, and the learners' engagement is assessed following a scale, then it is called service learning. It involves the application of knowledge and skills learned in the classroom and then making a complete plan of action 1.e. preparing a budget, starting the process of implementation, involving people and activating operational strategies.

sub_questions.explanation: Education plays a vital role in bringing about positive changes in behaviour. It helps us try to change our life as well as our society. Complete education not only illuminates our minds but also inspires us to work for the community. The purpose of education is not getting grades and receiving certificates. The main objective of education is to make life better. Civic engagement of the learners is highly appreciated all over the world nowadays. A civically engaged person works to create a difference in the civic life taking action or raising voice against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills. When we work for social welfare, we are civically engaged. Civic engagement may be individual or group activities. For example, we can raise voice against raising excessive taxes. This protest can be done by organising ralles, collecting signature, making human chains, etc. Learners engagement is evaluated by following a scale. Rnowledge and skills learned in the school is applied. in society for public welfare.

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage :

Sheikh Kamal knew that there is no shortcut to success. He groomed himself up as a young man who earned success by dint of perseverance and commitment. When the Pakistan military began its genocide in Bangladesh, he joined the Liberation War and received military training at Camp Murtee located at the Himalayan foothills in India. The tall young man who carried himself with dignity and possessed remarkable traits of leadership became the ADC of General Ataul Goni, Osmani, the Commander in Chief of Bangladesh Armed Forces during the Liberation War. After Independence, Sheikh Kamal could, easily remain in Bangladesh Army and pass a secure life but he preferred to engage himself in country building and organizing the young forces to that end, Journalist Syed Ishtiaq Rezi in one of his columns 'Ekjon Sheikh Kamal' in Bangla Tribune rightly says that the unique qualities of Sheikh Kamal's character, especially his wholehearted involvement in sports and culture are never seen in any son or daughter of any President, Prime Minister or High Officials in Bangladesh.

sub_questions.explanation: Sheikh Kamal exemplified perseverance and commitment, earning success through hard work. He joined the Liberation War during the Pakistan military's genocide in Bangladesh, receiving military training in India and serving as ADC to General Osmani. After independence, instead of pursuing a secure military career, he focused on nation-building and youth organization. Renowned for his involvement in sports and culture, his unique qualities distinguished him from other political figures' offspring in Bangladesh, as noted by journalist Syed Ishtiaq Rezi

questions.uddipok:
Write down the summary of the following poem:-
Hold fast to dreams
For if dreams die
Life is a broken-winged bird
That cannot fly.
Hold fast to dreams
For when dreams go
Life is a barren field
Frozen with snow.

sub_questions.explanation: The poem underscores the importance of holding or fostering a dream since life without dream is meaningless and it loses its true purpose. The poet compares such dreamless life with a 'broken-winged bird', which is unable to fly to reach its destination. In addition, the poet compares a life void of dream with a 'barren field' which is covered with frozen snow. Indeed, we must cherish a dream to be súccessful in life.

questions.uddipok:
The following sentences are jumbled. Rearrange them in proper sequence:
(i) One day, he was very hungry.
(ii) The grapes were too high for him to reach.
(iii) Again and again he jumped.
(iv) At last, he entered into a vineyard.
(v) Once upon a time, there lived a fox in a forest.
(vi) But each time, he failed to reach the grapes.
(vii) At last being tired, he went away saying that the grapes were sour.
(viii) He took a run and jumped to reach the bunch of grapes but could not reach it.
(ix) He searched food everywhere, but he did not get any food.
(x) There were ripe grapes hanging up on the vine.

sub_questions.explanation:
Here is the proper sequence of the sentences:
(v) Once upon a time, there lived a fox in a forest.
(i) One day, he was very hungry.
(ix) He searched food everywhere, but he did not get any food.
(iv) At last, he entered into a vineyard.
(x) There were ripe grapes hanging up on the vine.
(ii) The grapes were too high for him to reach.
(viii) He took a run and jumped to reach the bunch of grapes but could not reach it.
(iii) Again and again he jumped.
(vi) But each time, he failed to reach the grapes.
(vii) At last being tired, he went away saying that the grapes were sour.

sub_questions.explanation: The graph shows the choice of profession by different educated people in our country. The graph shows that farming is chosen as a profession by 10 % 10 \% 10% educated people. Then comes the business profession, and it is chosen by 20 % 20 \% 20% educated people. questions.uddipok: The following is the beginning of a story. Complete it in your own words: Once, there lived a woodcutter. He was very poor but honest. He lived on the bank of a river near a jungle. He used to cut wood...............

sub_questions.explanation:
Once, there lived a woodcutter. He was very poor but honest. He lived on the bank of a river near a jungle. He used to cut wood every day from the dense forest, selling it in the nearby village to make a meager living. Despite his hardships, he was content with his simple life and found joy in the beauty of nature surrounding him.
One day, while he was deep in the forest, he noticed something glimmering in the water. Curious, he approached the riverbank and discovered a beautiful golden axe submerged in the river. The woodcutter knew that this axe was not his, so he decided to leave it there. Suddenly, a fairy appeared before him, emerging from the water. She was impressed by his honesty and told him that she would reward him for his noble character.
The fairy asked the woodcutter if he wanted a new axe. He replied that he only needed a simple iron axe to continue his work. The fairy then gave him a sturdy, shining iron axe, and in return for his honesty, she granted him the ability to always find enough wood to sell and provide for his needs.
From that day on, the woodcutter’s life changed for the better. He worked hard, but now he always had enough wood to sell and even started saving money. He was able to help others in his village, sharing his fortune with those less fortunate than himself.
Years passed, and the woodcutter remained grateful for the fairy’s gift. He often visited the riverbank, where he first met her, to express his gratitude and remember the lesson of honesty and kindness. And so, the woodcutter lived happily, surrounded by the beauty of the forest and the friendship of his community.

questions.uddipok: Write a letter to your friend congratulating him/her on his/her getting first prize in English debate competition.

sub_questions.explanation:
Subject: Congratulations on Your First Prize in the English Debate Competition!
Dear [Friend's Name],
I hope this letter finds you in high spirits and overflowing with pride, as you very much deserve to be! I was thrilled to hear the fantastic news that you clinched the first prize in the English debate competition. Heartiest congratulations on this remarkable achievement!
Your victory comes as no surprise to me, knowing your passion for debate and your exceptional skills in articulating your thoughts eloquently. Your ability to command the stage with confidence and present persuasive arguments is truly commendable. It's evident that your hard work, dedication, and countless hours of preparation have paid off splendidly.
I must say, witnessing your growth and success fills me with immense joy and inspiration. Your performance in the competition not only showcased your talent but also served as a testament to your unwavering determination and commitment to excellence. You have set a shining example for all of us to follow.
Moreover, your victory is a testament to your perseverance and resilience in the face of challenges. Engaging in debates requires not only intellectual prowess but also the courage to defend your beliefs and ideas in the face of opposition. Your ability to navigate complex arguments and present them with clarity and conviction speaks volumes about your character and determination.
As you bask in the glory of your well-deserved triumph, I want you to know that your success is an inspiration to everyone around you. Your dedication, passion, and relentless pursuit of excellence serve as a beacon of hope and encouragement to all aspiring debaters. I have no doubt that your achievement will inspire others to reach for their dreams and strive for greatness.
Once again, hearty congratulations on this outstanding accomplishment! May this victory be the first of many more to come, and may you continue to shine brightly in all your future endeavors. I look forward to celebrating many more milestones with you in the days ahead.
Wishing you continued success, happiness, and fulfillment in everything you do.
Warmest regards,
[Your Name]
